p.span: The simulation is monitored by a camera.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: The camera has its own position (the center of the display window), it can be changed in different ways:

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: - Moving the mouse with the left button pressed will change the position of the camera.
- Double-clicking the object in object Explorer will lead to the fact that the position of the camera becomes equal to the position of the object at the moment of pressing.
- If you enable the option <<to Follow the selected object>>, the position of the camera at each moment in time is equal to the object position

- If enabled <<return the position of the camera after starting from the point of return>> and you clicked on the <<Starting from the point of return>>, the position of the camera becomes equal to the position of the camera in the moment you press <<to return>>
- When creating a new model or opening an existing one

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: The camera also has a scale. It is important to note that this scale is reversed to the normal scale: the larger its value, the smaller the objects. You can change the scale by scrolling the mouse wheel or by using the slider on the right side of the panel.
